hadiths.text: It was narrated that Sa'sa'ah bin Mu'awiyah said:"I met Abu Dharr and said: 'Tell me a Hadith.' He said. Yes, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: There is no Muslim worshiper who spends from each type of his wealth on a pair (of things) in the cause of Allah, but the keepers of Paradise will welcome him, all of them calling him to what they have (of reward).' I said: "How is that?" He said: "If it is camels, he gives two, and if it is cows, he gives two

chapter.ara-name: باب فَضْلِ النَّفَقَةِ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى .
chapter.eng-name: The Virtue Of Spending In The cause Of Allah
